description: Master Angular Directives: Structural (ngIf, ngFor), Attribute (ngClass, ngStyle), and how to create your own.

slides.title: Types of Directives
slides.content:
# Three Flavors üç®

1.  **Components:** Directives with a template.
2.  **Structural Directives:** Change the DOM layout by adding and removing DOM elements (`*`).
3.  **Attribute Directives:** Change the appearance or behavior of an existing element.

slides.title: *ngIf
slides.content:
# *ngIf üîÄ Conditionally includes a template. ```html
Welcome back!
Please login. ``` The `*` indicates it's structural syntax.

slides.title: *ngFor
slides.content:
# *ngFor üìã Repeat a node for each item in a list. ```html
  • {{ i + 1 }} - {{ hero.name }}
    • ```

slides.title: ngClass
slides.content:
# [ngClass] üíÖ Add or remove CSS classes dynamically. ```html
Hello
``` Classes are added if the boolean value is `true`.

slides.title: Code Example
Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Directives üéì

DOM Manipulation.

- **Structural (*):** `*ngIf`, `*ngFor`. Add/remove elements.
- **Attribute ([]):** `[ngClass]`, `[ngStyle]`. Change look.
- **Custom:** `@Directive` to encapsulate behavior.
- **HostListener:** React to user events.
